Dwarf.age: Dwarves mature at the sam e rate as humans, but they’re considered young until they reach the age of 50. On average, they live about 350 years
Dwarf.alignment: Most dwarves are lawful, believing firmly in the benefits of a well-ordered society. They tend toward good as well, with a strong sense of fair play and a belief that everyone deserves to share in the benefits of a just order
Dwarf.sizeDesc: Dwarves stand between 4 and 5 feet tall and average about 150 pounds. Your size is Medium.
Dwarf.speedDesc: Your base walking speed is 25 feet. Your speed is not reduced by wearing heavy armor.

traits.name: Darkvision
traits.desc: Accustom ed to life underground, you have superior vision in dark and dim conditions. You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it w ere dim light. You can’t discern color in darkness, only shades of gray

traits.name: Dwarven Resilience
traits.desc: You have advantage on saving throws against poison, and you have resistance against poison damage

traits.name: Dwarven Combat Training
traits.desc: You have proficiency with the battleaxe, handeaxe, throwing hammer, and warhammer

traits.name: Tool Proficiency
traits.desc: You gain proficiency with the artisan's tools of your choice: smith's tools, brewer's supplies, or mason's tools.

traits.name: Stonecunning
traits.desc: Whenever you make an Intelligence(History) check related to the origin of stonework,  you are considered proficient in the History sill and add double your proficency bonus to the check, instead of your normal proficiency bonus.

traits.name: Languages
traits.desc: You can speak, read, and write Common and Dwarvish. Dwarvish is full of hard consonants and guttural sounds, and those characteristics spill over into whatever other language a dw arf might speak.

traits.name: Subrace
traits.desc: Two main subraces of dwarves populate the worlds of D&D: hill dwarves and mountain dwarves. Choose one of these subraces.
